channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: TMC - Defects - Vegetation problem, 24th June
item.description:
28 day with 3 way traffic lights please cut back overgrown grass and hedges on verge restricting visibility out of junction approx 40m x 1m x 1m (Overgrown Hedge)
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: TMC - Defects - Vegetation problem, 24th June
item.description:
NWD with give and take plus temporary footway closure required please trim back overgrown tree branches grown out in footway back to boundary approximately 3 metres x3 metres (Overgrown Tree)
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Highways have ignored multiple large, deep potholes & fixed one tiny one, 24th June
item.description:
Highways have ignored multiple large, deep potholes & fixed one tiny one. Iâ€™ve then received an email to say that the problem has been rectified. But very large, deep potholes are still all over this road. How can this possibly be cost effective to ignore multiple problems and fix one small hole only?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cirencester Road, Ewens Farm, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
